body: Hm, yeah, the man page is wrong, it's in a separate section.

> Hm, yeah, the man page is wrong, it's in a separate section.

Do you know in which section it is?
It should be in its own section.

issue.title: Fix manpage docs for shell section

body: So why is this still showing the "old way"? https://alacritty.org/config-alacritty.html
It shows the right thing. `shell` is a part of `terminal` section.

```
[terminal.shell]
program = "/usr/bin/fish"

```
This is how it works now for me without warning messages. No clue if thats debian specific thing, but this is NOT what is shown on the link provided above.

that's also valid syntax. Link implies the
```toml
[terminal]
shell = { program = "/bin/zsh", args = ["-l"] }
```

Which is the same as you wrote. Assuming that you put everything into the single `[terminal]` section.

the following works
```toml
[terminal]
osc52 = "CopyPaste"

[shell]
program = "zsh"
args = ["-l", "-i", "-c", "zellij attach --index 0 --create"]
```

shell is in it's own section
Just ran into this same issue. Giving shell it's own separate section does the trick, but that is definetely not how it is documented on the homepage.

That's exactly how it's documented on the homepage:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d00ffa36-6b9d-43a2-9093-5f779b4de4ee)

> That's exactly how it's documented on the homepage:
> 
Are you saying that the website is correct? Because we can all see that it is not. It is documented as a key in the [terminal] section. 
Every other section (or "table") is clearly marked as such.
It is correct. They're equivalent representations and both work.

> It is correct. They're equivalent representations and both work.

Has there been some recent changes then in a version that I might not be having. Because I definitely tried both and only one actually worked
it was global before. On the wibsite, make sure that the docs are for the right version.

> it was global before. On the wibsite, make sure that the docs are for the right version.

I see, then I apologize, it's probably a mistake on my part then. I possibly expected some kind of notice or something, but apparently I need to invest more time in keeping my software up to date.

It's not like you have to keep things up to date, it's more like you have to read docs for your version in e.g. man page or by picking the right one on the website

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a2aa268a-780a-422d-98e7-283da37fbb2d)

> I possibly expected some kind of notice or something

There are generally temporary warnings when config options are migrated, but if you upgrade too slowly it's possible to miss them.
